attachments.fallback: [March 25th, 2021 5:34 PM] jacobszelko: Working with PyCall right now and was wondering - how can I call a custom function I wrote in Julia using pyjulia? Tried to read through the pyjulia docs but did not find anything on this. Thanks!
attachments.text: Working with PyCall right now and was wondering - how can I call a custom function I wrote in Julia using pyjulia? Tried to read through the pyjulia docs but did not find anything on this. Thanks!

text:
So back in the day I think you had to make a julia file /w the function and import it, or eval a function statement(little yuckier imo). but once it's in julia's brain you can just call?

Now I think you have to do something like...
```import Main from julia
Main.include("my illnast fn.jl")
cookies = Main.illnasty(pyObj)```
or something like that

elements.text:
So back in the day I think you had to make a julia file /w the function and import it, or eval a function statement(little yuckier imo). but once it's in julia's brain you can just call?

Now I think you have to do something like...

import Main from julia
Main.include("my illnast fn.jl")
cookies = Main.illnasty(pyObj)
